events.title: Battle of Dornach
events.description: The Swiss Confederation decisively defeated the army of the Duke of Milan, ending the Swabian War.
events.significance: This victory secured Swiss independence from the Holy Roman Empire and marked the end of the Swabian War.

events.title: First jukebox is installed
events.description: The first jukebox was installed at the Palais Royale Saloon in San Francisco, California, operated by coin mechanism.
events.significance: The invention popularized the playing of recorded music in public venues and was an early step in the development of the music industry.

events.title: Launching of the first geostationary communication satellite (Syncom 2)
events.description: NASA launched Syncom 2, the first geostationary communication satellite, into orbit.
events.significance: This marked a major milestone in communications technology, enabling reliable global satellite communication.

events.title: People's Republic of China admitted to the United Nations
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly voted to recognize the People's Republic of China as the legitimate representative of China, replacing the Republic of China (Taiwan).
events.significance: This represented a significant shift in diplomatic recognition and geopolitical dynamics during the Cold War era.

events.title: The Mars Global Surveyor spacecraft launched
events.description: NASA launched Mars Global Surveyor to study the surface and atmosphere of Mars.
events.significance: The mission greatly improved knowledge of the Martian environment and geography, contributing valuable data for future missions.
